newsitem.title: USA: Xoma files IND for psoriasis drug.
newsitem.headline: Xoma files IND for psoriasis drug.

text.p: XOMA Corp said it filed an Investigational New Drug application with the U.S. Food and Drug Administration, for clinical testing of hu1124 in patients with moderate to severe psoriasis.
Hu1124, which was previously referred to as anti-CD11a, is a humanized antibody product XOMA is developing in collaboration with Genentech Inc.
The trial will test the safety of hu1124 in psoriasis patients. XOMA and Genentech are also exploring hu1124 as a treatment to combat organ transplant rejection.
XOMA said between 400,000 and 800,000 people in the U.S. suffer from a moderate to severe form of psoriasis.

Researchers believe the skin disorder is caused by an inappropriate immune response directed against the body's own skin cells. The hu1124 product blocks the activation of certain immune system cells, or T-cells, which may inhibit their psoriasis-causing activity.
